Cincinnati.Dixie Terminal: The Dixie Terminal buildings in Cincinnati, Ohio, were completed in 1921 and served as a streetcar terminal, stock exchange and office building in the city's downtown business district. They were designed by Cincinnati architect Frederick W. Garber's Garber & Woodward firm. The main building includes an "Adamesque barrel-vaulted concourse" and "Rookwood Architectural Faience entry arch".
